[[1, "halterofilia", "Profesor: XXXX YYYY. Clase de Halterofilia."], [2, "crossfit", "Profesor:ZZZZ TTTT. Clase de CrossFit"], [3, "halterofilia", "Profesor:XXXX YYYY. Clase de halterofilia"]]
because its a SQL query result jsonified

from flask import Flask, jsonify
import json
import mysql.connector
import collections

app = Flask(__name__)

cnx = mysql.connector.connect(user="root", password="", host="localhost", database="gym")


@app.route('/gym/api/v1.0/clases', methods=['GET'])
def getClases():
    sql = "SELECT id, nombre, descripcion FROM clases"

    cursor = cnx.cursor()
    cursor.execute(sql)
    entradas = cursor.fetchall()

    # Convertir la en un array de entradas

    objects_list = []
    for row in entradas:
        objects_list.append(row)
    j = json.dumps(objects_list)
    return j

@app.route('/')
def index():
    return 'Hello, World!'


if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run(debug=True)
I think you need curvy brackets somewhere

any way to preview res files without opening them? Like, you know, there is a code preview, Ctrl+Shift+I in a small dialog. One thing that works with strings is Ctrl+Q but that's all. It shows useless R constant for other types of res

There are two popular libraries for implementing a shimmer effect on a TextView : <https://github.com/RomainPiel/Shimmer-android> and <https://github.com/facebook/shimmer-android>
however both libraries have not had any updates in a couple of years and are no longer being maintained. Also both libraries can trigger memory leaks in certain cases.
Is there any modern way to pull off this effect?

attachments.title: RomainPiel/Shimmer-android
attachments.text: Shimmer-android - An Android TextView with a shimmering effect

attachments.title: facebook/shimmer-android
attachments.text: shimmer-android - An easy, flexible way to add a shimmering effect to any view in an Android app.
